jobs.title: Devops Engineer (Temporary)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Location: Remote (within EU time zones preferred)
Duration: ~3–4 months (with potential for extension)

About us

The Agile Monkeys is a software boutique and a startup studio. We offer AI software consulting services and we build products related to AI and search such as AIFindr.ai and LLMfindr.com.

Why should you join us?

At Agile Monkeys, we’re not just building software - we’re shaping the future.

  • Future-proof your career by working at the cutting edge of AI and emerging tech.

  • Grow without limits in a team that thrives on curiosity, learning, and pushing boundaries.

  • Thrive in a culture people stay for, we have a high retention rate because people love working here.

  • Work your way: remote-friendly, flexible hours, and an outcomes-over-hours mindset.

  • Own your impact, we give you real responsibility, trust, and the freedom to innovate.

  • A safe place to stretch, we encourage bold thinking, learning from mistakes, and stepping outside the box.

  • We are bootstrapped over 14 years out of the Canary Islands, no dependency on investors.

Join an elite, collaborative team where excellence is the standard and every contribution matters.

The Role

We’re looking for a hands-on DevOps Engineer to join The Agile Monkeys for a temporary period while one of our core team members is on paternity leave. You’ll be working in a collaborative, fast-moving environment, ensuring the stability, scalability, and efficiency of our clients’ cloud platforms.

You’ll help maintain and evolve high-traffic cloud applications hosted on AWS and Azure, manage Kubernetes clusters, and improve our CI/CD pipelines, monitoring, and infrastructure automation. This is a great opportunity for a proactive engineer who enjoys problem-solving, ownership, and continuous learning.

Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain and optimize cloud-based infrastructure in AWS (ECS, ELB, EC2) and Azure (Compute, AKS, Load Balancers, etc).

  • Implement and maintain monitoring and logging solutions (Datadog, CloudWatch, Grafana, Prometheus, etc.).

  • Manage and troubleshoot Kubernetes clusters, ensuring smooth deployments and scalability.

  • Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions, Terraform, and Ansible.

  • Ensure infrastructure security, resilience, and cost efficiency.

  • Collaborate closely with backend and frontend teams to streamline deployment and release processes.

  • Contribute to improving our internal DevOps practices, automation, and documentation.

What We Value

At The Agile Monkeys, we care as much about how we work as what we build.

We’re looking for someone who:

  • 🧠 Takes ownership – you see a problem, you fix it.

  • ⚡ Is proactive – anticipates challenges and improves processes before they break.

  • 🌍 Adapts quickly – thrives in change and uncertainty, embraces pivoting when needed.

  • 🚀 Aims high – expects exceptional results from yourself and others.

  • 💡 Loves to learn – continuously explores new tools, methods, and ideas.

Requirements

Must-Have Skills:

  • Proven experience managing infrastructure in AWS (ECS, EC2, ELB, S3, etc.).

  • Strong knowledge of Kubernetes (deployment, scaling, monitoring).

  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform, Ansible).

  • Some experience with Linux like systemd configurations and bash scripting.

  • Experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions preferred).

  • Familiarity with logging and monitoring tools (Datadog, CloudWatch, Grafana).

  • Strong understanding of networking, security, and cloud architecture best practices.

  • Excellent communication skills in English.

Nice-to-Have:

  • Familiarity with multi-cloud environments.

  • Prior experience in high-availability production systems.

  • Interest in automation and developer experience improvements.

Benefits

  • Work hard, play hard - An additional day off work for your birthday and every month without a bank holiday

  • Outcome over hours - We offer maximum flexibility of where you work and when you work

  • Remote first - work from anywhere in the world as long as it’s within tax regulations

  • Wellbeing Support - we support your physical and mental health

  • Language lessons - it’s never too late to start

  • Mentorship program - to support your development and career growth

  • Gym Discount - stay fit, stay healthy

jobs.title: Head of Finance
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About us

The Agile Monkeys is a software boutique and a startup studio. We offer AI software consulting services and we build AI SaaS products such as AIFindr.ai and LLMfindr.com.

Why should you join us?

At Agile Monkeys, we’re not just building software - we’re shaping the future.

  • Future-proof your career by working at the cutting edge of AI and emerging tech.

  • Grow without limits in a team that thrives on curiosity, learning, and pushing boundaries.

  • Thrive in a culture people stay for, we have a high retention rate because people love working here.

  • Work your way: remote-friendly, flexible hours, and an outcomes-over-hours mindset.

  • Own your impact, we give you real responsibility, trust, and the freedom to innovate.

  • A safe place to stretch, we encourage bold thinking, learning from mistakes, and stepping outside the box.

  • We are bootstrapped over 14 years out of the Canary Islands, no dependency on investors.

Join an elite, collaborative team where excellence is the standard and every contribution matters.

Role Overview

We are looking for a hands-on and detail-oriented Head of Finance to lead the company’s financial operations. This role is key to ensuring robust financial processes, compliance with Spanish and international standards, and delivering accurate, timely reporting to support strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities

  • Oversee accounting, treasury, budgeting, forecasting, and financial reporting, ensuring compliance with Spanish GAAP and US GAAP.

  • Lead financial statement consolidation and coordinate external audits.

  • Manage end-to-end treasury operations, including cash flow, liquidity planning, payments, security controls, FX exposure, and surplus cash management, ensuring efficiency and risk mitigation across all fronts.

  • Review commercial contracts and collaborate with legal and HR advisors to manage labor and regulatory compliance (Spanish labor law, hiring, etc.)

  • Provide strategic financial insights to leadership and support decision-making.

  • Drive continuous improvement across the financial stack, including implementation and optimization of tools and processes.

What We Value

  • Excellence in execution: accuracy, ownership, and attention to detail in all financial deliverables.

  • Ability to operate in dynamic, fast-paced environments with a proactive, solution-oriented mindset.

  • Strong communication, leadership, and team collaboration skills.

  • Fluency in Spanish and English.

Benefits

  • Work hard, play hard - An additional day off work for your birthday and every month without a bank holiday

  • Outcome over hours - We offer maximum flexibility of where you work and when you work

  • Wellbeing Support - we support your physical and mental health

  • Language lessons - it’s never too late to start

  • Mentorship program - to support your development and career growth

  • Gym Discount - stay fit, stay healthy

jobs.title: Office Manager (Las Palmas)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About The Agile Monkeys

The Agile Monkeys is a software boutique and a startup studio. We offer AI software consulting services and we build products related to AI and search such as AIFindr.ai and LLMfindr.com.

Why should you join us?

At Agile Monkeys, we’re not just building software - we’re shaping the future.

  • Future-proof your career by working at the cutting edge of AI and emerging tech.

  • Grow without limits in a team that thrives on curiosity, learning, and pushing boundaries.

  • Thrive in a culture people stay for, we have a high retention rate because people love working here.

  • Work your way: remote-friendly, flexible hours, and an outcomes-over-hours mindset.

  • Own your impact, we give you real responsibility, trust, and the freedom to innovate.

  • A safe place to stretch, we encourage bold thinking, learning from mistakes, and stepping outside the box.

  • We are bootstrapped over 14 years out of the Canary Islands, no dependency on investors.

Join an elite, collaborative team where excellence is the standard and every contribution matters.

Role Overview

We’re looking for an organized, proactive, and hands-on Office Manager to ensure the smooth running of our office and daily operations.

You’ll be responsible for creating a comfortable, efficient, and engaging work environment, while supporting the team across a wide range of administrative, logistical, and cultural initiatives.

This role combines office management, event coordination, purchasing, and executive support, acting as a key connector between Operations, People, and Management.

Main Responsibilities

Office Management

  • Oversee the daily operations of the office: maintenance, cleaning, supplies, and workplace organization.

  • Manage inventories, orders, and replenishments (fruit, coffee, office materials, Friday lunches, etc.).

  • Coordinate and negotiate with suppliers (cleaning, catering, maintenance, furniture).

  • Lead the search and setup of new office spaces when needed.

  • Support sustainability initiatives and help monitor the company’s carbon footprint.


Events & Culture

  • Organize internal activities such as training sessions, yoga, workshops, and company events.

  • Coordinate the logistics for MonkeysCon / LearningCon and other internal gatherings.

  • Plan and execute company trips, retreats, or team-building activities.

  • Manage details that nurture company culture and employee engagement (gifts, celebrations, team moments).

  • Coordinate and host weekly Friday Talks or internal sharing sessions.

Administrative & Purchasing

  • Handle purchases of materials, merchandise, laptops, desks, chairs, and other office items.

  • Oversee logistics and shipments for other offices or remote employees.

  • Assist with invoice management and administrative documentation.

  • Coordinate official paperwork with notaries, registries, and external providers.

  • Support miscellaneous administrative tasks within operations or management.

Executive Assistance

  • Manage the leadership team’s calendar and coordinate internal and external meetings.

  • Support with document preparation, presentations, and other executive administrative needs.

Requirements

  • Experience in Office Management, Administration, or Operations.

  • Ability to multitask and prioritize in a dynamic environment.

  • Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

  • Experience in event organization or working in a startup/fast-paced environment is a plus.

Benefits

  • Work hard, play hard - An additional day off work for your birthday and every month without a bank holiday

  • Outcome over hours - We offer maximum flexibility of where you work and when you work

  • Remote first - work from anywhere in the world as long as it’s within tax regulations

  • Wellbeing Support - we support your physical and mental health

  • Language lessons - it’s never too late to start

  • Mentorship program - to support your development and career growth

  • Gym Discount - stay fit, stay healthy
